metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2588 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that the cls_route filter implementation in theLinux kernel would not remove an old filter from the hashtable beforefreeing it if its handle had the value 0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2588` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-191-generic - 3.13.0-191.242
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-191-lowlatency - 3.13.0-191.242
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-231-generic - 4.4.0-231.265~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-231-generic - 4.4.0-231.265~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-231-lowlatency - 4.4.0-231.265~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1111-aws - 4.4.0-1111.117
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1149-azure - 4.15.0-1149.164~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
